entries.name: Age
entries: Gnoll mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnoll are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fangs are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, as a bonus action you can move up to half your speed and make a {@i bite} attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.

legendaryGroup.name: Veldarin
regionalEffects: The region containing Veldarin's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Shadows come to life within 6 miles of the Archmage of Alyentlea's lair. Most of the time these living shadows are unnerving and nothing more, but when a creature acts against the interests of Veldarin, the shadows can interfere and cause any relevant die roll to be made with disadvantage.
Magic saturates the area within 6 miles of the lair, causing minor random effects similar to a prestidigitation cantrip.
Veldarin can cast their senses to any area containing darkness, dim light, or shadows within 6 miles of their lair, similar to a clairvoyance spell.

regionalEffects: If Veldarin dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 2d10 days.
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, Veldarin can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Veldarin can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Veldarin wills darkness to overpower the light. All bright light sources in the lair shed only dim light to their normal bright light radius, and dim light sources are extinguished. This lasts until Veldarin dismisses the effect or dies.

An opaque wall of writhing shadows springs up from a solid surface within 120 feet of Veldarin. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. Each creature in the area must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures in the wall's space are pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall they choose. A creature can move through the wall, but the semimaterial shadow resists intrusion. For every foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, any creature that, during its own turn, occupies any part of the wall's space takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to radiant damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. The wall lasts until Veldarin uses this lair action again, or until she dies.

Veldarin targets one creature within 60 feet of her and assails its mind with visions of hopelessness and despair. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until initiative count 20 on the next round.

legendaryGroup.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon
regionalEffects: The region containing a legendary gold dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Whenever a creature that can understand a language sleeps or enters a state of trance or reverie within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, the dragon can establish telepathic contact with that creature and converse with it in its dreams. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or remembers its conversation with the dragon and be be {@condition frightened} upon waking for 2 ({@damage 1d4}) days.

Banks of sickly, shadowy mist manifest within 6 miles of the dragon's lair. The mist lightly obscures the area. It assumes haunting forms when good creatures are near the dragon or other non-evil creatures in the mist, warning such creatures of the danger.
Gems and pearls within 1 mile of the dragon's lair lose color and start to give off a wispy, shadowy smoke.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, these effects end immediately.
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon glimpses the future, so it has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

One creature the dragon can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a dream plane, a different plane of existence the dragon has imagined into being. To escape, the creature must use its action to make a Charisma check contested by the dragon's. If the creature wins, it escapes the dream plane. Otherwise, the effect ends on initiative count 20 on the next round. When the effect ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that one is occupied.

legendaryGroup.name: Syl
regionalEffects: The region containing the Usurper's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Magic saturates the area within 6 miles of the lair, causing minor random effects similar to a prestidigitation cantrip.

The warforged army thoroughly patrols within 6 miles of the Syl's lair. Most of the time these soldiers are intimidating and nothing more, but when a creature acts against the interests of the Syl, the warforged can interfere and cause any relevant die roll to be made with disadvantage.
Syl can cast access the senses of any soldier within 6 miles of their lair, similar to a clairvoyance spell.

regionalEffects: If Syl dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 2d10 days.
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, Syl can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Syl can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Syl wills darkness to overpower the light. All bright light sources in the lair shed only dim light to their normal bright light radius, and dim light sources are extinguished. This lasts until Syl dismisses the effect or dies.

An opaque wall of writhing shadows springs up from a solid surface within 120 feet of Syl. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. Each creature in the area must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures in the wall's space are pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall they choose. A creature can move through the wall, but the semimaterial shadow resists intrusion. For every foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, any creature that, during its own turn, occupies any part of the wall's space takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to radiant damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. The wall lasts until Syl uses this lair action again, or until they die.

The Syl summons a warforged soldier to act as a companion in battle (your choice of unit). Roll 1d6. On a roll of 1-3, the soldier has a level of 4. On a roll of 4 or 5, the soldier has a level of 8. On a roll of 6, 2 level 8 soldiers appear.

legendaryGroup.name: Tyrant
lairActions: When fighting inside their Castle, the Tyrant and Ice Queen can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the monster can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The Caigwyn's summon one of the royal guard to assist in the battle. Guards summoned this way act at a group initiative that is rolled when the first one is summoned. When a guard is close to death, they flee, but if they are killed before fleeing, the guards make a {@dc 15} group Wisdom saving throw or all flee on their turn.

The Caigwyn's targets one creature either can see within 60 feet of it and challenge its force of will. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to leave its current space. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

An icicle falls from the ceiling which lands on a square area of ground within the lair, covering it with ice. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. The ice lasts for 1 hour or until it is melted away with fire. When the ice appears, each creature on it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage, fall {@condition prone} and slide 10 feet in a random direction determined by a d8 roll. A creature that succeeds the saving takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save, taking no damage on a success.

legendaryGroup.name: Stranger
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, the Stranger can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Stranger can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The Stranger rolls a d8 and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If they have no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.
The Stranger targets one 30 ft circle within 60. Blinky is forced to project its eye in that direction and that area is under the effect of the {@i anti-magic field} spell until the next turn.

The Stranger exacerbates a temporal anomaly in its lair. This abnormality materializes around one creatures they can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) force or psychic damage (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The anomaly then disappears.

entries: You have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing icicles to erupt from the blade. These icicles shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is afrost, it deals an extra {@dice 3d6} cold damage to any target it hits. The icicles last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

items.name: Veldrin's Pact Baton
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a {=bonusSpellAttack} bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, being attuned to this rod grants the following abilities.

entries.name: Veldrin's Favor
entries: This item has 2 charges. You can expend a charge as an action and regain a warlock spell slot while holding the rod. All expended uses recharge when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Veldrin's Protection
entries: You gain resistance to Psychic, Necrotic, and Radiant Damage. You are also immune to being {@condition frightened|PHB}.

entries.name: Veldrin's Arcana
entries: When attuned to this rod, all cantrips you cast act as if they are cast at a tier greater than they are. This means using an additional damage dice or having an additional target.

monster.name: Veldarin, Archmage of Alyentlea
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Veldarin's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless he wishes to be affected, Veldarin is immune to spells of 4th level or lower. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: If Veldarin has at least 1 hit point, he regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn.

trait.name: Arch-Caster
entries: Veldarin has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain your concentration on a spell. Veldarin does not have to make Concentration checks unless they receive more than {@b 40} hit points of damage.

trait.name: Aura of Undiscernability
entries: While Veldarin is wielding the {@i {@b Shadow Gauntlets}}, a creature that starts it's turn within 20 feet of Veldarin must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw, unless Veldarin is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is forced to question the metaphysical nature of Veldarin until the start of its next turn. Until this ends, the target can't take actions or reactions, and its speed is 0 and can't be increased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Veldarin's {@i Aura of Undiscernability} for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: when Veldarin drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to his domain the Feywild, and is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Improved Minor Illusion
entries: {@i Minor illusion} cast by Veldarin can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of the spell.

trait.name: Illusory Reality
entries: When Veldarin casts an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion can be made real. This can be done as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. It lasts for 1 minute and can not deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

trait.name: Illusory Aspects
entries: Veldarin's thoughts cannot be read and they cannot be affected by divination spells.

trait.name: Convincing Illusions
entries: Illusion spells cast by Veldarin that would fail physical inspection, can now pass as real.

trait.name: Illusionist's Cunning
entries: Illusion spells cast by the Archmage of Alyentlea gains all effects as if it was cast with a spell slot one level higher, up to a maximum of 9th level.

trait.name: Illusory Trickery (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Archmage of Alyentlea is permanently affected by {@i nystul's magic aura}, gaining both its effects. As a bonus action, they can invoke an illusory duplicate of yourself as if you had cast the {@i mirror image} spell.

trait.name: Deep Memory (2/Long Rest)
entries: Veldarin can exchange one memorized spell for any other spell as a bonus action.

trait.name: Prismatic Juggle
entries: When Veldarin casts a spell with a spell slot, that isn't of the same school as the previous spell you cast, within a minute of the last casting, the new spell is cast as if it is one level higher.

trait.name: Archmage
entries: Veldarin uses a meta physical spellbook that only they can open and read. They can conjure the book as a bonus action. The book contains all wizard spells and has an infinite number of pages.

trait.name: Swift Caster
entries: While wielding the {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}, Veldarin can use a bonus action to cast a spell that has a casting time of one action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spell Mastery
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Veldarin is an 30th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). Veldarin has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *illusion spell of first level or higher

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Veldarin attacks twice with his {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}} and uses his {@b {@i Mental Stunting}}.

action.name: Shadow Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is forced to question the metaphysical nature of Veldarin until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Spatially Unbound
entries: Veldarin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

action.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: Veldarin changes the nature of illusion spells with a duration of 1 minute or longer, (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), if they can see the illusion.

action.name: Mental Stunting
entries: Veldarin uses illusions to physically overwhelm one creature he can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 31 ({@damage 6d6 + 10}) cold damage, can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, Veldarin can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

reaction.name: Illusory Self (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against Veldarin they can create an illusory duplicate of themselves causing that attack to miss.

legendaryHeader: The Archmage of Alyentlea can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Veldarin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Mental Stunting
entries: Veldarin uses his {@b {@i Mental Stunting}}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Asmodeus uses his Teleport action.

legendary.name: Manipulate Intrigue
entries: Veldarin targets one creature that is his nature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack against a creature of Veldarin choice that he can see.

legendary.name: Shadow Gauntlets (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Veldarin attacks with his {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 1-5 Actions)
entries: Veldarin expends a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, 3rd-, 4th-, or 5th-level spell that he has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Summon Night Elf Matron (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: Veldarin magically summons a {@i Matron Mother}. The elf appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Veldarin, acts as Veldarin's ally, and can summon other elves if it has such power. The elf remains until Veldarin dies or until he dismisses it as an action.

monster.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Living Shadow
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

{@b Shadow Breath.} The dragon exhales shadowy mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Weakening Breath.} The dragon exhales gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC25 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Actor
entries: Le Capitaine has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: Le Capitaine can breathe underwater.

trait.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, Le Capitaine can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

trait.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When Le Capitaine hits a creature with eldritch blast, he can push the creature up to 10 feet away from him in a straight line

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Le Capitaine's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Le Capitaine is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Le Capitaine has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Le Capitaine can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he die.

action.name: Command Familiar
entries: Le Capitaine's familiar makes one Attack of its own with its Reaction.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine regains one warlock spell slot.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Le Capitaine he can force them to make a 16 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Le Capitaine turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. He remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Protect Familiar
entries: When Le Capitaine's familiar takes damage, it instead has resistance to that damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of Le Capitaine that can hear him misses with an attack, Le Capitaine can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

monster.name: Syl, Usurper of Gods
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Actor
entries: Syl has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Cloak of Displacement
entries: Attack rolls against Syl have disadvantage until they take damage, then the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn.

trait.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on Syl's ranged attack rolls

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Syl's darkvision.

trait.name: Eldritch Master (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Syl can spend 1 minute entreating their patron for aid to regain all the expended spell slots from thierr Pact Magic feature.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: Syl has advantage on Constitution saving throws that made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, Syl can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/day)
entries: If Syl fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Syl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Syl's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Veldrin's Arcana
entries: All cantrips Syl casts act as if they are cast one tier higher than they are; either using an additional damage dice or targeting an additional creature.

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When Syl hits a creature with eldritch blast, each damage roll gets a +6 bonus.

trait.name: Fey Vision
entries: The Usurper's sees creatures in the range of their blindsight as if they were highlighted in a purple light, even if they are hidden or {@condition invisible}. Attack rolls against these highlighted creatures have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Syl's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Syl is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Syl has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Syl makes three attacks.

action.name: Shadow Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduced by half.

action.name: Revengence
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) magical piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 5d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Syl can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he dies.

action.name: Dark Delirium (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Syl chooses a creature to must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} of Syl for 1 minute or until their concentration is broken, during which time the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which Syl chooses. The creature can see and hear only itself, Syl, and the illusion.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Syl causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Veldrin's Favor (2/Long Rest)
entries: Syl regains one warlock spell slot.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Syl he can force them to make a 20 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When Syl's familiar takes damage, they can to grant it resistance against that damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Syl turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. They remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until Syl attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

{@i Twinned Spell}: Zansariph can spend sorcery points equal to a spell's level (1 for a cantrip) to target a second creature in range with the same spell, as long as the spell at the level it's being cast is incapable of targeting more than one creature.
{@i Quickened Spell}: When Zansariph casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, they can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

monster.name: Carrion, The Guardian Devil

trait.name: Ultimate Blast
entries: When Carrion casts {@i eldritch blast}, the spell gets a +5 damage bonus and the target can be pushed up to 10 feet away in a straight line.

trait.name: Staff of Fire
entries: The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, Carrion can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, with a spell save {@dc 20}: {@i burning hands} (1 charge), {@i fireball} (3 charges), or {@i {@b wall of fire}} (4 charges).
The staff regains 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) expended charges daily at dawn. If Carrion expends the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

trait.name: Artillerist
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on Carrion's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Dark One's Blessing
entries: When reducing a hostile creature to 0 HP, Carrion gains {@b 21} temp HP.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When making an ability check or a saving throw, Carrion can add 5 ({@damage 1d10}) to the roll.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Carrion's darkvision.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: Carrion has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Hurl Through Hell (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When hitting a creature with an attack, Carrion can instantly transport the target through the lower planes. At the end of Carrion's next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Pyromancer
entries: Spells cast by Carrion ignore resistance to fire damage.
>-When rolling fire damage, any 1's can be rerolled, but the new rolls must be uses, but if it is another 1, it is treated as a 2.

>-Whenever Carrion cast a spell that deals fire damage, surround Carrion until the end of their next turn. While the flames are present, any creature within 5 feet of Carrion that hits them with a melee attack takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

entries: The Carrion casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Staff of Fire (Costs 2 Actions)

>Carrion makes an attack with the {@b {@i Staff of Fire}}.

entries: If {@b {@i Investiture of Flame}} is active, Carrion creates a 15 foot line in a direction they choose. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, takin 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Agduraash Caigwyn

trait.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: A creature that is {@condition frightened} of the Tyrant within 10 ft. of them has its speed is reduced to 0 and it takes 8 psychic damage if it starts its turn there.

trait.name: Aura of Courage
entries: The Tyrant and friendly creatures within 10 ft. can't be {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: The Tyrant grant all friendly creatures within 10 ft. a +5 bonus to all saving throws.

trait.name: Divine Health
entries: The Tyrant is immune to disease.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the Tyrant hits with a melee weapon attack, they can expend one spell slot to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) extra radiant damage to the target plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) for each spell level higher than 1st and and additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) against undead or fiends.

trait.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: When the Tyrant score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, they can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
>When the Tyrant makes a melee attack with a heavy weapon, they can take a -5 penalty to the attack roll to add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Scornful Rebuke
entries: Whenever a creature hits the Tyrant with an attack, that creature takes +5 psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Tyrant is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Tyrant has the following paladin spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tyrant makes two attacks.

action.name: Frost Tongue Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft.

action.name: Javelin of Lightning (1/Day)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. Once per day, on a hit, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage. Each other creature in the line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant uses one of the following abilities.

{@i Ice Breath} - As an action the Tyrant exhales in a 15 ft. cone. Each creature in range must make a 17 {@dc Constitution} saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@i Dragon Roar} - The Tyrant forces each creature of their choice within 30 feet to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute repeating the saving throw if it takes any damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

{@i Conquering Presence} - As an action, the Tyrant forces each creature of their choice within 30 feet to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or becomes {@condition frightened} of the Tyrant for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@i Guided Strike} - When the Tyrant makes an attack roll they can gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

action.name: Lay on Hands Pool (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant have a pool of healing power that can restore 80 HP. The Tyrant can touch a creature to restore any number of HP remaining in the pool, or 5 HP to either cure a disease or neutralize a poison affecting the creature.

action.name: Cleansing Touch (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant ends one spell on themself or on a willing creature that they touch.

action.name: Divine Sense (6/Long Rest)
entries: Until the end of The Tyrant's next turn, they can sense anything affected by the hallow spell or know the location of any celestial, fiend, undead within 60 ft. that is not behind total cover.

legendaryHeader: The Tyrant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Tyrant regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Tyrant moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Tyrant makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendary.name: Intimidate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Tyrant chooses a creature within 30 ft. and makes a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check contested by the targets Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. On failure the target is {@condition frightened} until the end o it's next turn.

monster.name: Arthur Desmoreaux

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Scholar's darkvision.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When the Scholar makes a melee attack against a creature, they don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether the Scholar hits or not.

trait.name: Scholar's Grasp
entries: The Scholar has advantage on all Intelligence Checks made to recall information.

trait.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, one creature visible within 30 feet of the Scholar is cursed for 1 minute unless the target dies, the Scholar dies, or is {@condition incapacitated}.
>Until then, they gain the following benefits:

items: The Scholar gains a 5 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll the Scholar make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
If the cursed target dies, the Scholar regains +17 hit points

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Scholar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Scholar is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The Scholar has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Scholar makes two attacks with their pact weapons.

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Tyranthraxus the Flamed One)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 12 ({@damage 1d4 + 10}) piercing damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft.

action.name: Pactbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: One with Shadows
entries: When the Scholar is in an area of dim light or darkness, they can use their action to become {@condition invisible} until they move or take an action or a reaction.

action.name: Create Pact Weapon
entries: As an action, the Scholar can create a pact weapon in your hand (the Scholar chooses the form, and is proficient with it, and it counts as magical). The Scholar can also transform a magic weapon into their pact weapon by performing a special ritual.

action.name: Radiant Flames (1/Day)
entries: Multi-hued flame surrounds the Scholar for 1 minute, until the wielder is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, or until the wielder extinguishes the flame (no action required). While inflamed, the wielder has telepathy with a range of 30 feet, and it can teleport as a bonus action up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. In addition, every creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Scholar must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the Scholar hits a creature with an attack with {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Tyranthraxus the Flamed One)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Accursed Specter (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Scholar slay a humanoid, they can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a {@i specter}. It gains 6 temporary hit points. It obeys the Scholar's verbal commands, and it gains a +4 bonus to its attack rolls. The {@i specter} remains until the end of their next long rest.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Scholar regains one warlock spell slot.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: If the target cursed by the Scholar's Hexblade's Curse hits them with an attack roll, roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses, regardless of its roll.

legendaryHeader: The Scholar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Scholar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Scholar moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Scholar makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendary.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper
entries: The Scholar uses the {@i {@b Rod of the Pact Keeper}}.

legendary.name: Pact Weapon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Scholar summons a pact weapon and attacks with it.

monster.name: Cachette

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: The Nomad has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track Aberrations, Humanoids and Monstrosities, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Nomad's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: The Nomad can move through nonmagical difficult terrain and nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them. The Nomad has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to Cities, the Coast, and the Underdark, the Nomad's proficiency bonus is doubled.

trait.name: Nomad's Boon
entries: The wielder has proficiency in checks using Vehicles (Land) and  Vehicles (Water). The Nomad has advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}), Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks.

trait.name: Skulker
entries: The Nomad can try to hide when only lightly obscured. Missing a ranged weapon attack, doesn't reveal their position, and dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on their Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in darkness, the Nomad is {@condition invisible} to any creatures that rely on darkvision to see them in that darkness.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The Nomad has a {@b +4} bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the Nomad's walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack as part of their {@i {@b Multiattack}} and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Feline Agility (Recharges after Moving 0 Feet in a Turn)
entries: The Nomad's speed doubles until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry (1/Turn)
entries: When the Nomad misses with a weapon attack, they can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

trait.name: Cloak of the Bat
entries: The Nomad has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Vanish
entries: The Nomad can use the Hide action as a bonus action cannot be tracked by nonmagical means, unless they choose to leave a trail.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nomad's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nomad is a 16-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The Nomad has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nomad makes two attacks.

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Borem of the Lake of Boiling Mud)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., or {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d4 + 11}) piercing damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft.

action.name: Oathbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) if the target is the Nomad's {@i sworn enemy}.

>Once a day the Nomad can declare the target of the attack their {@i sworn enemy} until it dies or until dawn seven days later. When your {@i sworn enemy} dies, you can choose a new one after the next dawn.

>The Nomad makes ranged attack rolls with this weapon against their {@i sworn enemy}, with advantage. In addition, the target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover, and the Nomad suffers no disadvantage due to long range.
>While the Nomad's {@i sworn enemy} lives, they have disadvantage on attack rolls with all other weapons.

action.name: Net of Holding
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 20 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} and the {@i Net of Holding} can be moved as if it weighed 5 pounds. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 20} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 25 slashing damage to the net (AC 23) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

action.name: Borem's Embrace (1/Day)
entries: The Nomad touches one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be coated in sticky, steaming mud. While it is coated in this way, the target's speed is halved, it can't use reactions, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until the Nomad is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, or until the target is immersed in water. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Borem of the Lake of Boiling Mud)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.

action.name: Nature's Veil (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Nomad can magically become {@condition invisible} as a bonus action until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against the Nomad without advantage, they can impose disadvantage on it.

legendaryHeader: The Nomad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Nomad regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Nomad moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Feline Agility
entries: The Nomad regains the use of their Feline Agility.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Nomad makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

monster.name: Regina Caigwyn

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The Ice Queen can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured.

trait.name: Voice of Authority
entries: When the Ice Queen casts a spell of 1st level or higher that targets an ally, that ally can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a creature of the Ice Queen's choice.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: The Ice Queen has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain your concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Embodiment of the Law (5/Long Rest)
entries: If the Ice Queen casts an enchantment spell of of 1st level or higher with the casting time of 1 action, the spell's casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

trait.name: Cloak of Arachnida
entries: The Ice Queen can move across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free and can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ice Queen can cast the following spells innately (spell save {@dc 13}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ice Queen is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Ice Queen has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Haask the Voice of Hargut)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 11 ({@damage 1d4 + 9}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft.

action.name: Haask's Presence (1/Day)
entries: The Ice Queen transforms into a Tiny, leech-like being and teleports onto the shoulder of a humanoid that it can see within 30 feet of it. The targeted humanoid must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Ice Queen. While the target is charmed, the Ice Queen has control of it on the target's next turn. At the end of that turn, the Ice Queen teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and returns to its normal form. The Ice Queen can't be targeted directly by any attack or other effect while it's in the slug-like form, but it is subject to areas of effect as normal. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Haask the Voice of Hargut)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.
When the Ice Queen uses this ability they take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Divine Intervention (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Ice Queen requests Helm's aid and has a 16% chance of succeeding. If successful, the Ice Queen can't use this feature again for 7 days, otherwise.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Short Rest)
entries: The Ice Queen uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Order's Demand}
items.entry: : Each creature of choice within 30 feet of the Ice Queen must succeed a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of your next turn or until the charmed creature takes any damage. The Ice Queen can also cause any of the charmed creatures to drop what they are holding.

items: {@b Turn Undead}: Each undead within 30 feet of the Ice Queen must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Ice Queen as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Ice Queen, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move. When an undead of CR {@b 3} or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, the Ice Queen can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

legendaryHeader: The Ice Queen can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Ice Queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Disengage
entries: The Ice Queen takes the disengage action.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ice Queen makes a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Intimidate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ice Queen chooses a creature within 30 ft. and makes a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check contested by the targets Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. On failure the target is {@condition frightened} until the end o it's next turn.

monster.name: The Woman
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Eyes Beyond Time
entries: The Stranger has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks.

trait.name: Magical Resistance
entries: The Stranger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Cloak of the Stranger
entries: The Stranger has a +1 bonus to saving throws.

trait.name: Stanger's Veil
entries: The Stranger has advantage on all checks made to hide their identity. In addition, after interacting with the Stranger, creatures must succeed a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or forget the interaction over the next few days. A creature attuned to a Nighteye Dagger automatically succeeds.

trait.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: The Stranger adds {@b +6} to their initiative rolls.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: The Stranger has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain your concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Wreathed in the Unknowable
entries: The Stranger is hidden from divination magic and can't be perceived through magical scrying sensors. When a creature targets the Stranger using the scrying spell or similar spell, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against it's own save {@dc or} take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Stranger is an 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The Stranger has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spell Mastery
headerEntries: The Stranger's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, (80/320), one creature. {@h}[1d8+1] piercing damage.

action.name: Walk Through Planes
entries: The Stranger enters the {@i Astral Plane} and remains there until they use an action to return to the plane they were on. The Stranger reappears in the last space they occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space.

action.name: Tharizdun's Bolt {@recharge 6}
entries: The Stranger selects one creature it can see that can see it with in 60 ft. The creature hit must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or experience short-term madness for 1 hour or long-term madness for 10 minutes. Consult the Short-Term and Long-Term Madness tables (see "Madness Effects" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) to determine the form of the madness. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of every 10 minutes if inflicted with short-term madness or at the end of each minute for long-term madness, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Momentary Stasis (6/day)
entries: The Stranger can force a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0 until the end of the Stranger's next turn or until the creature takes any damage.

action.name: Cloak of the Stranger (6 Charges; Recharges 1d6 at Dusk)
entries: By expending a charge, the Stranger casts {@i magic missile} as a 5th-level spell {@i (7 missles)}.

action.name: Spell Absorption (5 charges; Resets to 0 at Dawn)
entries: When the Stranger is targeted by a spell of 3rd level or lower, they can choose to be unaffected and this cloak stores one charge. The Stranger can expend all stored charges to regain a spell slot of a level equal to or less that the number of charges expended.

reaction.name: Chronal Shift (2/day)
entries: After anyone within 30 feet of the Stranger makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, they can force the creature to reroll. The target must use the result of the second roll.

reaction.name: Convergent Future
entries: When anyone makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, within 60 feet of the Stranger, they can use a reaction to ignore the die roll and decide whether the number rolled is the minimum needed to succeed or one less than that number. When the Stranger use this feature, they gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, the Stranger can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

legendaryHeader: The Stranger can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Stranger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Stranger casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Reaction (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Stranger regains their reaction.

legendary.name: Tharizdun's Bolt (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Stranger recharges and uses {@i {@b Tharizdun's Bolt}}.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 13 Actions)
entries: The Stranger uses a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that it has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, Zhihlah has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Zhihlah scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Zhihlah can take the following as a a bonus action: Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Zhihlah's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Zhihlah has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warned
entries: Zhihlah has advantage on initiative rolls and cannot be surprised.

trait.name: Reliable Talent
entries: Whenever Zhihlah makes an ability check that lets them add their proficiency bonus, a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Zhihlah is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Zhihlah instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Zhihlah deals an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Zhihlah doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Poisoner (4/Long Rest)
entries: Zhihlah can apply injury poison to a weapon as a bonus action. The poison lasts for 1 minute and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zhihlah's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Dagger of Warning
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow + 1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Zhihlah can halve the damage from an attack against them if they can see the attacker.

monster.name: Zhihlah

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the Thief has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the Thief scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The Thief can take the following as a a bonus action: Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Thief's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Thief has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Thieve's Clutch
entries: The Thief has advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks and checks made with Thieves' Tools.

trait.name: Reliable Talent
entries: Whenever the Thief makes an ability check that lets them add their proficiency bonus, a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The Thief ignores cover when making ranged attacks. They can also take a -5 penalty to an attack to do an additional 10 damage.

trait.name: Warned
entries: The Thief has advantage on initiative rolls and cannot be surprised.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Thief deals an extra 31 ({@damage 9d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Thief doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Death Strike
entries: When the Thief attacks and hits a creature that is surprised, the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take double the damage from the attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Thief's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Toxic Nighteye Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 15 ({@damage 1d4 + 13}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Rapier + 1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}[DEX 1D8 +1] piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Longbow of Warning
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Leer of Corruption {@recharge 6}
entries: The Thief hits one creature with a weapon attack. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of each minute, ending the effect on itself on a success. This ability can be used as a free action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Toxic Nighteye Dagger}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The Thief can halve the damage from an attack against them if they can see the attacker.

legendaryHeader: The Thief can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Thief regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Shift
entries: The Thief moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Vanish
entries: The Thief performs a Hide action. It can move up to half its speed before or after this action.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Thief makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

trait.name: Superior Caster
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.

trait.name: Bladesong (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Accursed can use a bonus action to start the Bladesong, which gives them the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: The Accursed gains a {@b +5} bonus to your AC.
The Accursed's walking speed increases by 10 feet.
The Accursed has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.
The Accursed gains a {@b +5} bonus to any concentration checks.

trait.name: Song of Victory
entries: While {@b {@i Bladesong}} is active, the Accursed adds {@b ++5} to the damage of melee weapon attacks.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (Once per Long Rest)
entries: Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover - up to a combined level of {@b 8}, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The Accursed has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't be 0put to sleep

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Accursed is an 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Accursed has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: * The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Accursed makes two attacks, or makes one attack and casts a cantrip.

action.name: Shortsword, +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage {@i {16 ({@damage 1d6 + 13}) with {@b bladesong}}}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage  {@i {13 ({@damage 1d4 + 11}) with {@b bladesong}}}.

reaction.name: Song of Defense
entries: When the Accursed takes damage while their {@b {@i bladesong}} is active, they can expend one spell slot the reduce that damage they take by 5 * the spell slot's level.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

trait.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: Whenever Daz'vol casts a spell using their {@i alchemist's supplies} as the spellcasting focus, that restores hit points or deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, they gain a {@b +4} bonus.

trait.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: Whenever Daz'vol drinks an {@i experimental elixir} they gain 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Daz'vol can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, while leaving their hands free.

trait.name: Spell-Storing Item (8 Charges)
entries: Daz'vol can expend a charge and cast {@i cure wounds} at 1st level.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: Daz'vol has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} Daz'vol can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} Daz'vol takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} Daz'vol is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} Daz'vol takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Daz'vol is a 13th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The Daz'vol has the following artificer spells prepared:
footerEntries: *spell that heals or deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Daz'vol's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). The Daz'vol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Repeating Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Vampire Bite (5/Long Rest)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, Daz'vol empowers himself in one of the following ways:

items: Regain hit points equal to the damage dealt by the bite.
Gain a bonus equal to the damage dealt, to the next ability check or attack roll you make.

reaction.name: Flash of Genius (4/Long Rest)
entries: When Daz'vol makes an ability check or a saving throw, they can add {@b +4} to the roll.

reaction.name: Mind Sharpener (4 Charges; Recharges 1d4 a Day)
entries: Whenever Daz'vol fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, they succeed instead, expending 1 charge.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When Gil is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a DEX saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Master of Tactics
entries: Gil can use the Help action as a bonus action. When using the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Gil deals an extra 13 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When Gil is hit by an attack when he can see the attacker, he can halve the attack's damage against.

trait.name: Benign Transportation (Recharges after a Conjuration Spell of 1st Level or Higher is cast)
entries: As a bonus action, the conjurer teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

trait.name: Keen Mind
entries: Hana always knows which way is north, how many hours left before the next sunrise or sunset, and can accurately recall anything they have seen or heard within the past month.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hana is an {@hit 6}th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). Hana has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Minor Conjuration
entries: Hana conjures an inanimate object smaller than 3 feet on a side that weighs less than 10 pounds. The object radiates dim light out to 5 feet and disappears after 1 hour, when you use this feature again, or if it takes any damage.

monster.name: Hurricane
languages: Understands Auran but does not speak it

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The Storm can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The Storm doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Living Storm
entries: The Storm is 3 ({@damage 1d6}) * 100 feet in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.
In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The winds extinguish open flames and disperse fog

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The storm magically shoots water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 5 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked prone.

action.name: Whelm {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

action.name: Freezing Strikes {@recharge 5}
entries: The Storm launches 3 ice spikes: +7 to hit, 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the this turn.

action.name: Tidal Breath {@recharge 6}
entries: The Storm unleashes a wave of frigid seawater in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage, and is pushed 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

trait.name: Actor
entries: Le Capitaine - X has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Le Capitaine - X's darkvision.

trait.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: Le Capitaine - X can breathe underwater.

trait.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, Le Capitaine - X can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

trait.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When Le Capitaine - X hits a creature with eldritch blast, he can push the creature up to 10 feet away from him in a straight line

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
