action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Le Capitaine - X can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he die.

action.name: Command Familiar
entries: Le Capitaine - X's familiar makes one Attack of its own with its Reaction.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine - X causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine - X regains one warlock spell slot.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Le Capitaine - X he can force them to make a 16 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Le Capitaine - X turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. He remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Protect Familiar
entries: When Le Capitaine - X's familiar takes damage, it instead has resistance to that damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of Le Capitaine - X that can hear him misses with an attack, Le Capitaine - X can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Blessed Healer
entries: When the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit casts a healing another creature, they regain HP equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Whenever the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit uses a healing spell, the creature regains additional HP equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Divine Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

entries: The Vampire Bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

entries: The Vampire Bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: Vampire Bats don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or contract a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hit points except by magical means, and the target's hit point maximum decreases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}) every 24 hours. If the target's hit point maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies and is reborn as a vampire.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Vampire Rat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Vampire Rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Vampire Rat's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Vampire Rat to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a {@dc of} 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Vampire Rat drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses

If the target's hit point maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies and is reborn as a vampire.

monster.name: Witherling Horde
languages: Understands Gnoll but does not speak it

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The Horde can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the Horde can move through any opening large enough for a medium humanoid. The Horde can only regain hit points through its {@b {@i Endless Meat}} ability. The Horde cannot gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Discarded Impedance
entries: If the Horde takes {@b 30} damage in one turn, an area within it's space becomes difficult terrain for other creatures. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. If the Horde has half of its hit points or fewer, the area is reduced to 5 feet on a side.

trait.name: Endless Meat (1/Turn)
entries: The Horde can contaminate the remains of a large or smaller creature within its space, and gain 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) hit points. The creature must be medium or smaller creature if the Horde has half of its hit points or fewer. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within the Horde's space, the Horde can use this ability without expending a use.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the Horde reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the Horde can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bites attack.

trait.name: Unmanageable Size
entries: If the Horde has more than half of its hit points, it has advantage on Strength saving throws, and disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Horde makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club, or two with its club.

action.name: Bites

action.name: Clubs

reaction.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: In response to a gnoll being reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the Horde, it makes a melee attack. If the gnoll was within the Horde, it makes 2 attacks.

items.entry: : The D.E.A.C.O.N. restores 85 HP spread among any creatures within 30 ft. of them. Creatures cannot be healed past half of its hit point maximum.

items: {@b Turn Undead}: Each undead within 30 feet of the D.E.A.C.O.N. must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the D.E.A.C.O.N. as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of D.E.A.C.O.N., take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move. When an undead of CR {@b 4} or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Leadership Exclusive Guard Automaton and Tactical Expert} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn, when the L.E.G.A.T.E. deals slashing damage, they can reduce the target's speed by 10 feet until the start of the L.E.G.A.T.E.'s next turn.
When the L.E.G.A.T.E. scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of the L.E.G.A.T.E.'s next turn.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can add {@b +3} to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use their proficiency bonus.
They can cover an additional {@b +6} feet when making a running long jump.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from the L.E.G.A.T.E. even if they take the Disengage action before leaving their reach. When the L.E.G.A.T.E. hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E.'s weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. regains {@b +9} hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and less than {@b 110} hit points.

trait.name: Evasion of the Empire
entries: When the L.E.G.A.T.E. triggers attacks of opportunity, those attacks are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Nimbleness of the Empire
entries: On each of its turns, the L.E.G.A.T.E. can use a bonus action to take the Dash action.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Short Rest)
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: L.E.G.A.T.E. can reroll a saving throw that they fail but must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: L.E.G.A.T.E. makes theee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can use a bonus action to regain 23 ({@damage 1d10 + 18}) HP.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can impose disadvantage on an attack roll from a creature they can see again a target within 5 feet of the L.E.G.A.T.E..

reaction.name: Sentinel
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the L.E.G.A.T.E. makes an attack against another target (without the {@i Sentinel} feat), the L.E.G.A.T.E. can make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Regal Enforcer Galvanizing Exemplary Neutralization Tactics} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Crusher
entries: Once per turn, when the R.E.G.E.N.T. deals bludgeoning damage, they can move the target's speed by 5 feet to an unoccupied space.
When the R.E.G.E.N.T. scores a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against the target have advantage until the start of the R.E.G.E.N.T.'s next turn.

trait.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: When the R.E.G.E.N.T. scores a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduces a creature to 0 hit points on their turn, they can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
Before making a melee attack with a heavy weapon, the R.E.G.E.N.T. can choose to take a {@b -5} penalty to the attack roll to add {@b +10} to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can add {@b +3} to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use their proficiency bonus.
They can cover an additional {@b +5} feet when making a running long jump.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T.'s weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can reroll a saving throw that they fail but must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. makes three attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 (1d8 - 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can use a bonus action to regain 20 ({@damage 1d10 + 15}) HP.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Survival and Combat Optimized Unit and Tracker} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in darkness, the S.C.O.U.T. is {@condition invisible} to any creatures that rely on darkvision to see them in that darkness.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. has a +2 bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the S.C.O.U.T.'s walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Before making a ranged weapon attack, S.C.O.U.T. can choose to take a {@b -5} penalty to the attack roll to add {@b +10} to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Favored Foe (5/Long Rest)
entries: When the S.C.O.U.T. hits a creature with an attack roll, they can mark the target as their favored enemy for 1 minute or until they lose concentration. The first time the S.C.O.U.T. hits their favored enemy on each of your turns the hut does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the S.C.O.U.T. no extra movement. They can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition the S.C.O.U.T. has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the {@i entangle} spell.

trait.name: Nature's Veil (5/Long Rest)
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. can magically become {@condition invisible}, as a bonus action, until the start of your next turn.

trait.name: Vanish
entries: On each of its turns, the S.C.O.U.T. can take the Hide action. The S.C.O.U.T. can also not be tracked by non magical means.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: Once per turns, when the S.C.O.U.T. misses a weapon attack, they can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The S.C.O.U.T.'s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The S.C.O.U.T. is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). S.C.O.U.T. has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. makes two attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tireless (5/Long Rest)
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. can give themself 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. imposes disadvantage on an attack roll a creature makes against them without advantage on the roll.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: The Arc Fighter has advantage on DEX saving throws against effects they can see.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The Arc Fighter has advantage on initiative rolls. Also, the Arc Fighter can act normally when surprised if they enter a rage before doing anything else.

trait.name: Rage (4/Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action enter a rage for up to 1 minute (10 rounds). The Arc Fighter gains advantage on STR checks and saving throws (not attacks), {@b +3} melee damage with STR weapons, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. The rage ends early if they are knocked {@condition unconscious} or if their turn ends and they haven't attacked a hostile creature since their last turn or taken damage since then. The Arc Fighter can also end the rage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
entries: If the Arc Fighter drops to 0 hit points while raging and they don't die, they can make a DC {@b 10} CON saving throw. If they succeed, they drop to 1 hit point instead. The {@dc increase} by 5 each time the Arc Fighter uses this after the first, resetting to {@b 10} after a short or long rest.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of their turn, the Arc Fighter can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against they have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Strom Aura
entries: This can be activated as a part of a rage, or as a bonus action while raging. When this effect is activated, the Arc Fighter can choose one other creature you can see in your aura to make a {@dc 16} DEX save taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage and taking half damage on a successful save.

trait.name: Storm Soul
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage, you can breathe underwater and your swimming speed becomes 30 feet.

trait.name: Shielding Storm
entries: Each creature the Arc Fighter chooses has the damage resistance you gained from the Storm Soul feature while the creature is in the Storm Aura.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: The Arc Fighter rolls one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when hitting a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, the Arc Fighter can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of their next turn.
When the Arc Fighter scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls, until the start of the Arc Fighter's your next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Arc Fighter makes two attacks.

action.name: Greataxe, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Reduce damage dealt to you by 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4})

trait.name: Manifest Mind (Recharges after a Long Rest; or a Spell Slot is spent to use it)
entries: As a bonus action a Tiny spectral tome hovers in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the Lightning Scribe. It sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and disappears if it is 300 feet away from them. While manifested, the tome can hear and see, has 60 ft. of darkvision and can telepathically share with Lightning Scribe what it sees and hears (no action required).
As a bonus action, the tome to hover up to 30 feet. It can pass through creatures but not objects.

trait.name: Manifest Mind - Cast Spell (4/Long Rest)
entries: When casting a wizard spell, the Lightning Scribe can cast it from the spectral tome's space.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When finishing a short rest, the Lightning Scribe can recover expended spell slots - up to a combined level of {@b 5}, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Awakened Spellbook
entries: When casting a wizard spell of 4th level or lower, the Lightning Scribe can replace its damage type lightning damage.

trait.name: Elemental Adept
entries: Spells cast by the Lightning Scribe ignore resistance to lightning damage and, when rolling lightning damage for a spell they cast, any 1 on a damage die is treated as a 2.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Lightning Scribe is a 11th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability for wizard spells is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Lightning Scribe has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Longsword, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Channel Divinity (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Lightning Scribe uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.
{@i Destructive Wrath} - When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

{@i Turn Undead} - Each undead within 30 feet of the Lightning Scribe must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Lightning Scribe as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Lightning Scribe, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Reduce damage dealt to you by 8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2})

reaction.name: Wrath of the Storm (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature hits the Lightning Scribe with an attack, the creature to make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.
